file_intent.text: Data loading and query processing for document retrieval

responsibilities.label: Global state management
responsibilities.description: Handles the loading of pagerank and inverted index data into global dictionaries (pagerank_dict, word_info_dict, doc_info_dict) for use in query processing. Does NOT manage the lifecycle or usage of these dictionaries beyond loading. The specific usage of these dictionaries in other parts of the application is not detailed here.

responsibilities.label: Separation of loading logic
responsibilities.description: Isolates data loading functions from query processing to enhance modularity and maintainability. This separation allows for easier testing and potential reuse of loading logic. However, the implications of this separation on performance or complexity are not addressed.

responsibilities.label: API query processing
responsibilities.description: Processes incoming queries and returns relevant document hits as a JSON response. The expected input format for query parameters is not explicitly validated within this file, and the implications of changing the input format are not discussed.

responsibilities.label: Control flow management
responsibilities.description: Manages the transition from data loading to API endpoint handling, ensuring that the necessary data is loaded before queries can be processed. Dependencies on the successful loading of data are implied but not explicitly stated, which could lead to runtime issues if not properly managed.

responsibilities.label: Error handling strategies
responsibilities.description: Addresses potential error handling mechanisms for loading functions, although specific implementations are not detailed. This lack of clarity may affect the overall stability of the application during data loading operations.
